column4: how can I compare two directories (and all subdirs). I've read about the dircmp command but not installed on ubunto :/
Perhaps use diff?
Like 'diff <(ls dir1) <(ls dir2)'
thought diff is only for files..
The '<(command)' creates a temp file filled with the output of 'command'
Not sure I understand.. :/
Let me find you a link
What shell do you use?
the default ubuntu 'terminal'
Thansk ;)
You got it? Here's a link if you need... http://tldp.org/LDP/abs/html/process-sub.html
Ahh ok... so what output should I expect? If I understand correctly from diff manual, if I get no output the directories are identical
I don't really know what the output of diff should be, but yes, there will be no output if the directories are identical
That's just if they have the same filenames.
Ah
And to check if they are exactly same files? cmp?
The command I gave you doesn't care whether or not the files are actually the same (i.e. have the same hash).
You may need to write a more complicated script.
Aww... you know of any utility.. I basically if a backaup wnt well :)
A quick google doesn't show anything similar...
I couldn't find a package with dircmp either
Yes I know :(
I think you'll have to write your own script
Ok thanks
